creator: hshaik@cisco.com
text:
Apache WebServer fails to start if it is installed in a Compaq
Raid Array Controller 431 with three Ultra Wide SCSI-III disks configured as a
Raid-5 logical-disk.
The error_log message is:

file .\main\http_main.c, line 5990, assertion "start_mutex" failed

Workaround:   install CW2000 on IDE disk

That code doesn't run for Solaris, does it?  Please verify that the OS is really
Solaris, or update the PR fields as appropriate.
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
Sorry, I missed your previous update of this bug (asking for the platform
confirmation.)

Yes, It is not found for Solaris. This problem is found on Windows 2000 Server SP1.

Please let me know if you need more information.
creator: hshaik@cisco.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
changing product to win32...  can't find such an assertion at line 5990 of
Apache 1.3.24's http_main.c, so not sure 1.3.24 is correct Apache level

I'm guessing that special device drivers are used for the RAID-5 and they don't
support something related to the mutex creation, but Win32 person needs to look
at this issue.

creator: hshaik@cisco.com
text:
Any reason why this bug is marked as invalid? Is there a way to handle mutex 
creation failure conditions ?

A report that gives the wrong operating system, wrong apache version, and bogus
line number is too clue-challenged to take seriously, unless there's some
independent evidence of it making sense.

And the (1998) product affected is long-since obsolete.
creator: nick@webthing.com
